page.title: 01Conisbrough 1985
page.content: Conisbrough is an ancient village remaining small until the sinking of Cadeby Main colliery around 1890.Since then it has gradually expanded to its present{population of twenty thousand,largely dependent on{coal}.For a number of years coal production at the colliery has been declining and is expected to cease in the near future.There is little local alternative{employment, in spite of government schemes in nearby Denaby Main, another mining village where the colliery has closed. One sixth of the survey area is covered by Conisbrough and Conanby villages which join into one unit.The rest of the area is open countryside, used for arable{farming}with a small amount of rough grasing.Unemployment is about fifteen percent with little prospect of improvement immediately.
